parameters: \p2Where are we going? Let's join the meeting!
\p2Where are we going? Let's join the meeting!
\chiefSo it IS you four! When I heard these soldiers
were assisted by a group of brave adventurers,
your team was my first thought.
\chiefWe need a plan moving forward. What happened to
Greenfield is horrific, but there's nothing we
can do about it. We need to make sure the same
thing doesn't happen to Solus Valley!
\knightRight... but is there really anything we CAN do?
like we blinked, then the town was suddenly
\knightClearly \c[18]his\c[0] army is extremely mobile. We'll need
\p3But how are we going to track \c[18]him\c[0] down if all our manpower
is on defense? The attacks aren't going to stop until
\c[18]he\c[0]'s razed every last city to the ground.
\chiefI hear what you're saying. The fact of the matter is that we
don't stand a chance against \c[18]him\c[0] if more cities fall. Losing
Solus Valley would relinquish control of the Easin Plains
to \c[18]Apocalypse\c[0]. Who knows what \c[18]he\c[0]'ll be able to do then?
is OUR job. After all, that's what we've been doing
\p4Do you have any leads that could help us
kind of at a dead end right now.
\chiefWell, actually... I DO know someone that might
have pertinent information. I'm not sure how
willing they are to give it up, though.
\chiefHow about this? You three from Greenfield need to work on
moving the survivors. You four, come outside with me.
We're going to pay a visit to the town jail.
\knightOn behalf of the town of Greenfield... well, whatever's left of it...
thank you for your help. We are most certainly in your debt.

\solWe'll help the survivors soon. I just need some of
